Wisdom: إِنْ تَبْذُلُوا أَمْوَالَكُمْ فِي جَنْبِ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ مُسْرِعُ الْخَلَفِ
enWisdom: If you spend your wealth for the sake of Allah, then [know that] indeed Allah is quick in recompense

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِلَى إِنْفَاقِ مَا اكْتَسَبْتُمْ أَحْوَجُ مِنْكُمْ إِلَى اكْتِسَابِ مَا تَجْمَعُونَ
enWisdom: Verily you are more in need of spending [in charity] that which you earn than [you are of] earning that which you amass

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِلَى إِجْرَاءِ مَا أَعْطَيْتُمْ أَشَدُّ حَاجَةً مِنَ السَّائِلِ إِلَى مَا أَخَذَ مِنْكُمْ
enWisdom: Verily you are in greater need of the reward for that which you give than the asker is [in need] of that which he takes from you

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ أَغْبَطُ بِمَا بَذَلْتُمْ مِنَ الرَّاغِبِ إِلَيْكُمْ فِيمَا وَصَلَهُ مِنْكُمْ
enWisdom: Verily you will gain more joy by [the reward of] what you have given than the one who seeks from you gains in what he has received from you

Wisdom: بَسْطُ الْيَدِ بِالْعَطَاءِ يُجْزِلُ الْأَجْرَ وَيُضَاعِفُ الْجَزَاءَ
enWisdom: Stretching out the hand in giving increases reward and multiplies recompense

Wisdom: ثِيَابُكَ عَلَى غَيْرِكَ أَبْقَى لَكَ مِنْهَا عَلَيْكَ
enWisdom: Your garments are more lasting for you when worn by others rather than yourself

Wisdom: جُودُوا بِمَا يَفْنَى تَعْتَاضُوا عَنْهُ بِمَا يَبْقَى
enWisdom: Be generous with that which perishes and you will be compensated for it with that which lasts

Wisdom: جُودُوا فِي اللَّهِ وَجَاهِدُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ عَلَى طَاعَتِهِ يُعْظِمْ لَكُمُ الْجَزَاءَ وَيُحْسِنْ لَكُمُ الْحَبَاءَ
enWisdom: Be generous for the sake of Allah and struggle against your selves in obedience to Him, He will [in return] magnify your reward and increase His favour upon you

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لِأَحَدٍ مِنْ دُنْيَاهُ إِلَّا مَا أَنْفَقَهُ عَلَى أُخْرَاهُ
enWisdom: Nobody gains anything from his worldly life except that which he spends on others

Wisdom: مَنْ يُعْطِ بِالْيَدِ الْقَصِيرَةِ يُعْطَ بِالْيَدِ الطَّوِيلَةِ
enWisdom: One who gives with a short arm is given with a long arm

Wisdom: مَنْ بَسَطَ يَدَهُ بِالْإِنْعَامِ حَصَّنَ نِعْمَتَهُ مِنَ الِانْصِرَامِ
enWisdom: Whoever extends his hand to bestow favours [to others] has protected his [own] blessing from cessation

Wisdom: مَنْ بَذَلَ فِي ذَاتِ اللَّهِ مَالَهِ عَجَّلَ لَهُ الْخَلَفَ
enWisdom: Whoever spends his wealth in the way of Allah, He quickly replaces it [for him]

Wisdom: مَا أَكَلْتَهُ رَاحَ وَمَا أَطْعَمْتَهُ فَاحَ
enWisdom: That which you have eaten has gone, but what you have fed to others spreads [like a pleasant fragrance]
